intro: Cussonia gamtoosensis, commonly known as the Gamtoos cussonia, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
